title: Garlic Butter Steak
description: Juicy pan-seared steak with garlic butter.
steps: Season steaks generously with salt and pepper.
Heat a pan over high heat.
Sear steaks 3–4 minutes per side.
Add butter and garlic, baste steaks.
Rest before serving.

title: Salmon with Crispy Potatoes and Avocado Crema
Sausage, Sweet Potato & Bean Casserole
description: A lovely one-pot winter warmer of sausages, sweet potato and beans finished with a gremolata to keep things fresh. Perfect for a cold weeknight dinner.
steps: Peel and dice the sweet potato into roughly 3cm cubes.
Place a large pan over a medium heat and add a drizzle of olive oil. Add the sausages and potatoes and cook for 5 mins until well coloured.
Reduce the heat to low, finely slice the onions and garlic and add along with the tomato puree and rosemary. Cook for another few mins until the onion softens.
Pour in the beans and the water. Pop a lid on the pan and cook for about 10 mins until the potatoes have softened.
Peel a few strips of the lemon zest using a vegetable peeler. Finely mince the lemon zest and the parsley and mix together to make a gremolata.
Plate up with sausages and beans and sprinkle over the gremolata and a drizzle of olive oil. Finish with a squeeze of the lemon juice.

title: Grilled Chipotle Chicken and Corn Dense Bean Salad
description: Charred chicken and corn, spicy vinaigrette, and crunchy vegetables.
ingredients: For the Salad: 3 ears of corn
steps: Add the peppers, lime juice, oil, water, salt, and garlic to a blender and blend until creamy and bright orange.
Use a fork to poke some holes in the chicken so the marinade can penetrate better and pour the marinade over it.
Cover and let marinate in the fridge for at least and hour but up to overnight.
Grill chicken and corn and allow to chill.
Add diced bell peppers, minced coriander and minced red onion to a large bowl.
rinse and drain butter beans and chickpeas and add them to the bowl.
Add sliced cherry tomatoes, cubed avocado, chopped, cooled chicken, and corn to the bowl.
Mix the oil, lime juice, vinegar, chipotle powder, cumin, salt, and mayonnaise in a jar (can use a milk frother to make it creamy).
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss everything together.
Can add jalepenos/cheese is desired

title: Sheet-Pan Tikka Masala
ingredients: 1 medium red onion, very thinly sliced
700g baby yellow potatoes, halved, quartered if larger
2 tbsp vegetable oil for potatoes plus extra for cooking
1/2 serrano chile, seeded, finely chopped, plus more for serving
steps: Pickled Onions: In a medium bowl, toss onion, lime juice, and a few large pinches of salt until combined. Let sit until ready to use.

Chicken & Potatoes: Preheat oven to 425°. In a large bowl, combine yogurt, paprika, garam masala, turmeric, and 1 tablespoon salt. Add chicken and toss to coat. Let marinate at room temperature at least 15 minutes, or cover and refrigerate up to 2 hours.
Meanwhile, on a large baking sheet, toss potatoes with oil; season with salt and pepper. Roast 10 minutes.
Carefully nestle chicken onto baking sheet. Continue to roast, tossing potatoes halfway through, until chicken is golden brown and cooked through and potatoes are tender and crisp, 35 to 45 minutes.

Sauce & Assembly: In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, heat oil. Cook onion, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 7 minutes. Add chile, ginger, and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in tomato paste, garam masala, and turmeric and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 1 minute more.
Stir in tomatoes and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until thickened, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cream; season with salt and pepper.
Using an immersion blender, blend sauce until smooth (or transfer sauce to a standard blender and blend until smooth), about 1 minute. Keep sauce warm.
Spoon some sauce over chicken right out of the oven. Top with pickled onions, chiles, and cilantro. Serve with remaining sauce alongside.

title: Sausage meatballs, Leek, & Butterbeans with Romesco
description: One-pan roasted meatballs, leeks and tomatoes on a bed of romesco.
steps: Roast the peppers at 200°C until blackened and peel.
Chop the flat-leaf parsley.

Slice the leeks into 2cm thick circles. Form equally-sized balls with the sausage meat. Add a splash of oil to a deep oven tray and add the leeks, sausage, tomatoes and oregano with a touch of seasoning.

Decant all the ingredients for the romesco sauce into a food processor and blitz until moderately smooth. A few almond chunks are fine and welcome. If you can, let marinade in the fridge for ~30 minutes.
Put the tray with leeks, sausage, and tomatoes into the oven at 200°C. Cook for ~10 minutes, turning the sausage.

Add the butter beans, and a sprinkling of parsley, and give the tray a good shake. Back into the oven for ~15 minutes. If you haven’t browned the meat previously, sticking the tray on the top shelf for 5-10 minutes with occasionally turning can help. Once the meat is cooking, the tomatoes bursting open, and the leeks are soft, it’s ready for serving.
To serve, lay down a thick base of Romesco sauce, add tomatoes, leeks, and butter beans, and top with sausage and parsley. A garnish of lemon wedges or zest is a welcome addition.

title: Breakfast Bagel
description: Bagel with jalapeno garlic chive cream cheese, avo, egg and sriracha.

title: Banana Breakfast Bowl
description: Breakfast bowl with banana, coconut flakes, peanut butter and granola.

title: Chocolate Guinness Cake
steps: Preheat the oven to 180°C. Grease and line a 23cm (9 inch) springform cake tin.
Pour the Guinness into a large, wide saucepan and add the butter. Melt slowly over a low heat, stirring occasionally.
As soon as the butter has melted, whisk in the cocoa powder and caster sugar.
In a medium jug or bowl, beat the sour cream, eggs and vanilla extract together. Pour this mixture into the pan of Guinness and melted butter and whisk well.

Sieve together the flour, bicarbonate of soda and instant espress powder, if using. Whisk the dry ingredients into the pan of wet ingredients. As soon as you have a smooth batter and no pockets of flour remain, stop whisking.
Pour the cake batter into the lined tin and bake for 45-60 minutes or until the cake has risen and a skewer inserted in the middle of the cake emerges with no wet batter
Place the cake tin on a wire cooling rack and let it cool completely in the tin.

To make the frosting, lightly whip the cream cheese until smooth, then sieve in half of the icing sugar. Beat until smooth, then add the remaining icing sugar and beat until smooth. Pour in the vanilla extract and double cream and beat until you have a light, smooth frosting.

To assemble the cake, carefully remove it from the tin and peel off the baking paper. Set the cake on a serving plate, then top with the cream cheese frosting, swirling the top with a small palette knife to make it look like the top of a pint of Guinness.

title: One-pan Lemon Garlic Chicken and Potatoes
ingredients: Zest of 1 lemon, plus the juice of 2 lemons (you need ¼ cup/60 ml of lemon juice)
½ tsp freshly cracked black pepper
6 medium all-purpose potatoes, cut into wedges
1 tbsp fresh oregano or parsley, to garnish
Steamed greens or green salad, to serve
steps: Preheat the oven to 200°C.

In a large bowl, combine the olive oil, oregano, garlic, lemon zest and juice, sweet paprika, dijon mustard, sugar, salt and pepper. Add the chicken and toss to coat. Marinate for up to 24 hours or cook immediately.

Arrange the potatoes in an even layer in a large baking pan and top with the chicken. Scrape out any marinade left in the bowl and coat the potatoes with it, using your hands. Ensure the chicken cutlets are not overlapping
Add the chicken stock to the base of the pan.
Scatter the lemon slices around the pan on top of the potatoes only (avoid placing the lemon slices on the chicken as it stops the skin from browning).
Bake for 55–60 minutes or until the chicken is golden and cooked through, shuffling the potatoes to stop them burning and adding the olives at around the 30-minute mark.
Sprinkle the chicken with fresh oregano or parsley and serve with your side of choice.
